name: app.R
content:
# ============================================================================= # PBA Scoring Dashboard # ============================================================================= # # Interactive dashboard for exploring plant scores with adjustable weights. # # ============================================================================= library(shiny) library(dplyr) library(DT) # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Load Data # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Load anonymized data (for both local and deployment) scores_raw <- read.csv("plant_scores.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Default Parameters (from score_plants.R) # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- defaults <- list( # Pathway weights (must sum to 1) pathway_stack = 60, pathway_slag = 18, pathway_acid = 10, pathway_fugitive = 12, # Measurement source weights (must sum to 1) meas_air = 50, meas_soil = 25, meas_blood = 25, # Discount rate for population (delta per 100m) delta = 0.99, # Rate vs Total weight (0 = pure rate, 100 = pure total) rate_vs_total = 0, # Tier thresholds tier_green = 30, tier_yellow = 60, # Reference values throughput_ref = 5000, cpBLL_per_harm = 8500 ) # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # UI # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- ui <- fluidPage( # Custom CSS for tier colors and styling tags$head( tags$style(HTML(" .tier-green { background-color: #28a745 !important; color: white !important; font-weight: bold; } .tier-yellow { background-color: #ffc107 !important; color: black !important; font-weight: bold; } .tier-red { background-color: #dc3545 !important; color: white !important; font-weight: bold; } .slider-group { background-color: #f8f9fa; padding: 15px; border-radius: 8px; margin-bottom: 15px; } .slider-group h4 { margin-top: 0; color: #495057; } .weight-display { font-family: monospace; font-size: 12px; color: #6c757d; margin-top: 5px; } h2 { color: #212529; border-bottom: 2px solid #007bff; padding-bottom: 10px; } .main-score { font-size: 18px; font-weight: bold; } ")) ), titlePanel("PBA Plant Scoring Dashboard"), sidebarLayout( sidebarPanel( width = 3, # Pathway weights div(class = "slider-group", h4("Pathway Weights"), p("Relative importance of each emission pathway.", style = "font-size: 12px; color: #6c757d;"), sliderInput("w_stack", "Stack", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$pathway_stack, step = 1), sliderInput("w_slag", "Slag", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$pathway_slag, step = 1), sliderInput("w_acid", "Acid", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$pathway_acid, step = 1), sliderInput("w_fugitive", "Fugitive", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$pathway_fugitive, step = 1), htmlOutput("pathway_weights_display") ), # Measurement source weights div(class = "slider-group", h4("Measurement Weights"), p("How much to weight each data source.", style = "font-size: 12px; color: #6c757d;"), sliderInput("w_air", "Air (current)", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$meas_air, step = 1), sliderInput("w_soil", "Soil (historical)", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$meas_soil, step = 1), sliderInput("w_blood", "Blood (direct)", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$meas_blood, step = 1), htmlOutput("meas_weights_display") ), # Population discounting div(class = "slider-group", h4("Population Discounting"), p("How much to weight nearby vs. distant population.", style = "font-size: 12px; color: #6c757d;"), sliderInput("delta", "Delta (per 100m)", min = 0.90, max = 1.00, value = defaults$delta, step = 0.01), p("1.0 = all population counts equally", style = "font-size: 11px; color: #6c757d;"), p("0.9 = distant population discounted heavily", style = "font-size: 11px; color: #6c757d;") ), # Rate vs Total div(class = "slider-group", h4("Rate vs. Total"), p("Should we score on harm per battery (rate) or current damage (total)?", style = "font-size: 12px; color: #6c757d;"), sliderInput("rate_total", "Weight toward Total", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$rate_vs_total, step = 5), p("0 = Pure rate (harm per battery)", style = "font-size: 11px; color: #6c757d;"), p("100 = Pure total (current damage)", style = "font-size: 11px; color: #6c757d;") ), # Tier thresholds div(class = "slider-group", h4("Tier Thresholds"), sliderInput("tier_green", "Green threshold", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$tier_green, step = 5), sliderInput("tier_yellow", "Yellow threshold", min = 0, max = 100, value = defaults$tier_yellow, step = 5) ), # Reset button actionButton("reset", "Reset to Defaults", class = "btn-secondary btn-sm") ), mainPanel( width = 9, h2("Plant Rankings"), p("Ranked from best (lowest score) to worst. Tier based on final score."), DTOutput("scores_table"), br(), h2("Column Definitions"), h4("Core"), tags$table(class = "table table-striped table-sm", tags$tbody( tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Score"), style = "width: 15%;"), tags$td("Primary score used for tiering. Blends harm rate and total based on slider. Lower = better.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Tier")), tags$td("Green (acceptable), Yellow (needs work), Red (exclude). Based on Score thresholds.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Pop")), tags$td("Population density factor. 1.0 = sparsest area; higher = more people nearby = more harm.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Throughput")), tags$td("Tons of batteries processed per year.")) ) ), h4("Pathways", style = "margin-top: 15px;"), p("Higher = more emissions from that pathway = worse.", style = "font-size: 13px; color: #6c757d; margin-bottom: 5px;"), tags$table(class = "table table-striped table-sm", tags$tbody( tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Stack"), style = "width: 15%;"), tags$td("Emissions from furnace exhaust. Low = good baghouse, scrubber, clear exhaust.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Slag")), tags$td("Emissions from waste. Low = proper containment, no visible slag, good furnace.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Acid")), tags$td("Emissions from electrolyte. Low = hammermill, neutralization, responsible supply chain.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Fug")), tags$td("Fugitive dust escaping. Low = enclosed building, negative pressure, good LEV.")) ) ), h4("Measurements", style = "margin-top: 15px;"), p("Higher = more lead detected = worse.", style = "font-size: 13px; color: #6c757d; margin-bottom: 5px;"), tags$table(class = "table table-striped table-sm", tags$tbody( tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Air"), style = "width: 15%;"), tags$td("Lead in air samples. Reflects current emissions.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Soil")), tags$td("Lead in soil samples. Reflects historical/cumulative emissions.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Blood")), tags$td("Lead in blood samples. Direct measure of human exposure.")) ) ), h4("Harm", style = "margin-top: 15px;"), p("Higher = more harm = worse.", style = "font-size: 13px; color: #6c757d; margin-bottom: 5px;"), tags$table(class = "table table-striped table-sm", tags$tbody( tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Rate"), style = "width: 15%;"), tags$td("Harm per battery. Answers: 'should batteries go here?'")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Total")), tags$td("Current total harm (rate x throughput). Answers: 'how much damage now?'")) ) ), h4("PV(cpBLL)", style = "margin-top: 15px;"), p("Present value of cumulative person-BLL. Actual harm in physical units.", style = "font-size: 13px; color: #6c757d; margin-bottom: 5px;"), tags$table(class = "table table-striped table-sm", tags$tbody( tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Rate"), style = "width: 15%;"), tags$td("Person-ug/dL of blood lead per ton of batteries processed.")), tags$tr(tags$td(tags$b("Total")), tags$td("Total person-ug/dL caused by plant's current operations.")) ) ), br(), h2("Understanding the Sliders"), h4("Pathway Weights"), p("Lead emissions come from four pathways: stack (furnace exhaust), slag (waste disposal), acid (battery electrolyte), and fugitive (dust escaping the building). By default, weights reflect each pathway's share of maximum potential emissions. Stack dominates because uncontrolled furnaces emit the most lead. Adjust these if you believe certain pathways matter more or less than our defaults suggest."), h4("Measurement Weights"), p("We estimate emissions from three data sources. ", tags$b("Air"), " captures current operations — what's happening right now. ", tags$b("Soil"), " captures historical emissions — cumulative over years. ", tags$b("Blood"), " directly measures human exposure — the outcome we ultimately care about. ", "Default weights favor air (50%) because it reflects current practices, with soil and blood (25% each) providing validation. ", "If you trust blood measurements as ground truth, increase its weight. If you think historical practices matter, increase soil."), h4("Population Discounting (Delta)"), p("Should a plant in a remote area be scored the same as one in a dense city? Delta controls how much we weight nearby vs. distant population. ", "At delta = 1.0, all population counts equally regardless of distance — only total nearby population matters. ", "At delta = 0.90, distant population is heavily discounted — plants in sparse areas get lower scores. ", "This is a value judgment: do emissions matter if no one is nearby to absorb them?"), h4("Rate vs. Total"), p("This is perhaps the most important conceptual choice. ", tags$b("Rate"), " (harm per battery) answers: 'If we had a battery to recycle, should we send it here?' ", tags$b("Total"), " (current damage) answers: 'How much harm is this plant causing right now?' ", "We default to rate because shutting down a high-throughput, low-rate plant could push batteries to worse alternatives. ", "But if your goal is to identify the biggest current problems, weight toward total."), h4("Tier Thresholds"), p("Where do we draw the lines between Green (suitable for responsible sourcing), Yellow (needs improvement), and Red (exclude from supply chain)? ", "These thresholds are policy choices, not scientific facts. Adjust based on how strict you want the certification to be.") ) ) ) # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Server # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- server <- function(input, output, session) { # Reset to defaults observeEvent(input$reset, { updateSliderInput(session, "w_stack", value = defaults$pathway_stack) updateSliderInput(session, "w_slag", value = defaults$pathway_slag) updateSliderInput(session, "w_acid", value = defaults$pathway_acid) updateSliderInput(session, "w_fugitive", value = defaults$pathway_fugitive) updateSliderInput(session, "w_air", value = defaults$meas_air) updateSliderInput(session, "w_soil", value = defaults$meas_soil) updateSliderInput(session, "w_blood", value = defaults$meas_blood) updateSliderInput(session, "delta", value = defaults$delta) updateSliderInput(session, "rate_total", value = defaults$rate_vs_total) updateSliderInput(session, "tier_green", value = defaults$tier_green) updateSliderInput(session, "tier_yellow", value = defaults$tier_yellow) }) # Normalized pathway weights pathway_weights <- reactive({ raw <- c(input$w_stack, input$w_slag, input$w_acid, input$w_fugitive) total <- sum(raw) if (total == 0) return(c(0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25)) raw / total }) # Normalized measurement weights meas_weights <- reactive({ raw <- c(input$w_air, input$w_soil, input$w_blood) total <- sum(raw) if (total == 0) return(c(0.33, 0.33, 0.34)) raw / total }) # Display normalized pathway weights output$pathway_weights_display <- renderUI({ w <- pathway_weights() HTML(sprintf( "
Normalized: Stack %.0f%% | Slag %.0f%% | Acid %.0f%% | Fug %.0f%%
", w[1]*100, w[2]*100, w[3]*100, w[4]*100 )) }) # Display normalized measurement weights output$meas_weights_display <- renderUI({ w <- meas_weights() HTML(sprintf( "
Normalized: Air %.0f%% | Soil %.0f%% | Blood %.0f%%
", w[1]*100, w[2]*100, w[3]*100 )) }) # Recalculate scores based on current slider values scores_adjusted <- reactive({ pw <- pathway_weights() mw <- meas_weights() # Scale factors for pathway weights (relative to default 100 total) # Default: stack=60, slag=18, acid=10, fugitive=12 # New weights need to scale the max points for each pathway stack_max <- 60 * (pw[1] / 0.60) slag_max <- 18 * (pw[2] / 0.18) acid_max <- 10 * (pw[3] / 0.10) fugitive_max <- 12 * (pw[4] / 0.12) total_max <- stack_max + slag_max + acid_max + fugitive_max # For measurement reweighting within stack/fugitive # We need to recalculate measurement points with new weights scores_raw %>% mutate( # Recalculate measurement points with new weights # Air gets mw[1] of the measurement allocation, etc. stack_meas_quality = (stack_air_pts / 0.50 * mw[1]) + (stack_soil_pts / 0.25 * mw[2]) + (stack_blood_pts / 0.25 * mw[3]), fugitive_meas_quality = (fugitive_air_pts / 0.50 * mw[1]) + (fugitive_soil_pts / 0.25 * mw[2]) + (fugitive_blood_pts / 0.25 * mw[3]), # Pathway QUALITY totals (internal calculation) stack_quality = (stack_assessment_pts + stack_meas_quality) * (pw[1] / 0.60), slag_quality = slag_pts * (pw[2] / 0.18), acid_quality = acid_pts * (pw[3] / 0.10), fugitive_quality = (fugitive_assessment_pts + fugitive_meas_quality) * (pw[4] / 0.12), # Pathway HARM (what we display - higher = more emissions = worse) # Max points per pathway after weight adjustment stack_max = 60 * (pw[1] / 0.60), slag_max = 18 * (pw[2] / 0.18), acid_max = 10 * (pw[3] / 0.10), fugitive_max = 12 * (pw[4] / 0.12), stack_harm = stack_max - stack_quality, slag_harm = slag_max - slag_quality, acid_harm = acid_max - acid_quality, fugitive_harm = fugitive_max - fugitive_quality, # Measurement HARM (higher = more lead detected = worse) meas_max = 33 * ((pw[1] + pw[4]) / 0.72), # Approximate max for stack+fugitive measurements air_harm = (15 * mw[1] / 0.50) - (stack_air_pts / 0.50 * mw[1]), soil_harm = (7.5 * mw[2] / 0.25) - (stack_soil_pts / 0.25 * mw[2]), blood_harm = (7.5 * mw[3] / 0.25) - (stack_blood_pts / 0.25 * mw[3]), # Raw quality (internal) raw_quality_adj = stack_quality + slag_quality + acid_quality + fugitive_quality, # Raw harm (what we use for scoring - higher = worse) raw_harm_adj = 100 - raw_quality_adj, # L_i adjustment for delta # This is approximate - would need full recalc with raster for accuracy # For now, scale L_i based on delta change # Higher delta = less discounting = L_i closer to 1 delta_ratio = log(input$delta) / log(defaults$delta), L_i_adj = 1 + (L_i - 1) * delta_ratio, L_i_adj = pmax(1, L_i_adj), # Harm rate and total harm_rate_adj = L_i_adj * raw_harm_adj, harm_total_adj = harm_rate_adj * throughput_tons_yr / defaults$throughput_ref, # Blend rate and total based on slider rate_weight = 1 - input$rate_total / 100, final_score = rate_weight * harm_rate_adj + (1 - rate_weight) * harm_total_adj, # cpBLL: total = harm_total * k, rate = total / throughput cpBLL_total_adj = harm_total_adj * defaults$cpBLL_per_harm, cpBLL_rate_adj = cpBLL_total_adj / throughput_tons_yr, # Tier based on final score tier_adj = case_when( final_score <= input$tier_green ~ "Green", final_score <= input$tier_yellow ~ "Yellow", TRUE ~ "Red" ) ) %>% arrange(final_score) %>% mutate(rank = row_number()) }) # Render the scores table output$scores_table <- renderDT({ df <- scores_adjusted() %>% select( Rank = rank, Plant = plant_name, Tier = tier_adj, Score = final_score, # Pathways (HARM - higher = more emissions = worse) Stack = stack_harm, Slag = slag_harm, Acid = acid_harm, Fug = fugitive_harm, # Measurements (HARM - higher = more lead detected = worse) Air = air_harm, Soil = soil_harm, Blood = blood_harm, # Location Pop = L_i_adj, # Throughput (moved here, between Pop and Harm) Throughput = throughput_tons_yr, # Final metrics Rate = harm_rate_adj, Total = harm_total_adj, `cpBLL Rate` = cpBLL_rate_adj, `cpBLL Total` = cpBLL_total_adj ) %>% mutate( across(where(is.numeric) & !matches("Rank|Throughput|cpBLL"), ~round(.x, 1)), across(matches("cpBLL"), ~format(round(.x, 0), big.mark = ",")), Throughput = format(Throughput, big.mark = ",") ) # Create container with grouped headers sketch <- htmltools::withTags(table( class = 'display', thead( tr( th(rowspan = 2, '', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(rowspan = 2, 'Plant', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(rowspan = 2, 'Tier', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(rowspan = 2, 'Score', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(colspan = 4, 'Pathways', style = 'text-align: center; border-bottom: 2px solid #dee2e6;'), th(colspan = 3, 'Measurements', style = 'text-align: center; border-bottom: 2px solid #dee2e6;'), th(rowspan = 2, 'Pop', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(rowspan = 2, 'Thru', style = 'text-align: center;'), th(colspan = 2, 'Harm', style = 'text-align: center; border-bottom: 2px solid #dee2e6;'), th(colspan = 2, 'PV(cpBLL)', style = 'text-align: center; border-bottom: 2px solid #dee2e6;') ), tr( th('Stack', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Slag', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Acid', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Fug', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Air', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Soil', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Blood', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Rate', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Total', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Rate', style = 'text-align: center;'), th('Total', style = 'text-align: center;') ) ) )) datatable( df, container = sketch, options = list( pageLength = 20, dom = 't', # Just the table, no search/pagination ordering = FALSE, columnDefs = list( list(className = 'dt-center', targets = '_all'), list(className = 'main-score', targets = 3) # Score column ) ), rownames = FALSE, class = 'cell-border stripe hover' ) %>% formatStyle( 'Tier', backgroundColor = styleEqual( c('Green', 'Yellow', 'Red'), c('#28a745', '#ffc107', '#dc3545') ), color = styleEqual( c('Green', 'Yellow', 'Red'), c('white', 'black', 'white') ), fontWeight = 'bold' ) %>% formatStyle( 'Score', fontWeight = 'bold', fontSize = '14px' ) }) } # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Run App # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
